Entries.default:
A stone lectern stands before you. Its surface reads:

"While scions of forest and adra fought, the dreams of invaders died."
[Leave.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume I: The Collapse of Grand Vailia.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume II: The Tribe of the People of the Deer.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume III: The First Hollowborn.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume IV: The Founding of Readceras.]
[Examine the lectern.]
The rain and ozone scent of arcane energy wafts from the lectern. There appears to be a spell imprinted in the stone.

A stone lectern stands before you. Its surface reads:

"They carried potential born of a word and shared like a secret."
A device inscribed with arcane runes glows dimly before you. The runes request an answer to their questions.
You notice nothing especially unusual about the stone, except that it was finely crafted and appears to be the recipient of frequent dusting.
It looks as though a book could be placed here.
There is already a book resting in the indentation.
It looks as though a book could be placed here.
There is already a book resting in the indentation.
[Activate the runes.]
[Leave.]
Arcane energy hums in harmony, and the wall before you begins to shimmer with light.
The air sparks with discordant energy, and the runes go dark. Their questions remain unanswered.
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume I: The Collapse of Grand Vailia.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume II: The Tribe of the People of the Deer.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume III: The First Hollowborn.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume IV: The Founding of Readceras.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume I: The Collapse of Grand Vailia.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume II: The Tribe of the People of the Deer.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume III: The First Hollowborn.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume IV: The Founding of Readceras.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume I: The Collapse of Grand Vailia.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume II: The Tribe of the People of the Deer.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume III: The First Hollowborn.]
[Remove The History of Eora, Volume IV: The Founding of Readceras.]
[Examine the lectern.]
The rain and ozone scent of arcane energy wafts from the lectern. There appears to be a spell imprinted in the stone.
You notice nothing especially unusual about the stone, except that it was finely crafted and appears to be the recipient of frequent dusting.

The rain and ozone scent of arcane energy wafts from the lectern. There appears to be a spell imprinted in the stone.
You notice nothing especially unusual about the stone, except that it was finely crafted and appears to be the recipient of frequent dusting.
[Examine the lectern.]
The rain and ozone scent of arcane energy wafts from the lectern. There appears to be a spell imprinted in the stone.
You notice nothing especially unusual about the stone, except that it was finely crafted and appears to be the recipient of frequent dusting.
[Leave.]
[Leave.]
[Leave.]
[Lick the runes.]

They're warm and lively as bare skin, but limned with a spark of arcane energy. They taste bitter.

When you pull away, every hair on your body is standing on end.
"Perhaps you should keep... that... to yourself for a while, Watcher."
"Eugh! ...Can I try?"
